channel.title: Smithing.. Please help
channel.description:
Hello, I'm trying to fix my smithing so it does 1,5,10,x, and was following this turorial; [url=http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/snippets/430015-smithing-1-5-10-x.html]http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/snippets/430015-smithing-1-5-10-x.html[/url]
Now, I get this error after compiling it all. Please, please, please help asap.
src\server\model\players\packets\BankX2.java:54: error: reached end of file whil e parsing } ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: Smithing.. Please help
item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

Well you said you followed a tutorial, the first thing you should do is see if that tutorial requires other tutorials and if the tutorial is even compatible with your server. And if you got those errors I am pretty sure other people have so check the thread and see if other people solved those error. I can’t even help much since the link is censored

Read full topic

item.title: Smithing.. Please help
item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

[/quote][/quote]

What will that solve? Please explain, his issue is not the parsing error. Either variables are missing or he’s calling methods that don’t exist, etc.

item.title: Smithing.. Please help
item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

[quote=“KFC, post:5, topic:459799”][quote author=xxx123xxx link=topic=562701.msg4102957#msg4102957 date=1347709867]

[code=java]
package server.model.players.packets;

import server.model.players.Client;
import server.model.players.PacketType;
/**

  • Bank X Items
    **/
    public class BankX2 implements PacketType {
    @Override
    public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) {
    int Xamount = c.getInStream().readDWord();
    if (Xamount == 0)
    Xamount = 1;
    switch (c.xInterfaceId) {

                     case 5064:
                 	if(c.inTrade) {
                         	c.sendMessage("You can't store items while trading!");
                         		return;
                 	}
                 	c.getItems().bankItem(c.playerItems[c.xRemoveSlot] , c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
                 break;
                         
                 case 5382:
                 	c.getItems().fromBank(c.bankItems[c.xRemoveSlot] , c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
                 break;

                 case 3322:
                 	if(!c.getItems().playerHasItem(c.xRemoveId, Xamount))
                 		return;
                 	if(c.duelStatus <= 0) {
            			 c.getTradeAndDuel().tradeItem(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
    			 } else {                                
                         	c.getTradeAndDuel().stakeItem(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
                 	 }  
                 break;
                         
                 case 3415: 
                 	if(!c.getItems().playerHasItem(c.xRemoveId, Xamount))
                			return;
                 if(c.duelStatus <= 0) { 
             		c.getTradeAndDuel().fromTrade(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
                 } 
                 break;
                         
                 case 6669:
                 	if(!c.getItems().playerHasItem(c.xRemoveId, Xamount))
                                 return;
                 	c.getTradeAndDuel().fromDuel(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
                 break;                        
         }
         if(c.isSmelting == true)
                 c.getSmithing().startSmelting(c.packetType, Xamount);

    }
    }[/code]
    Yup, you missed a brace at the end.
    [/quote]
    I get 50 errors with that…[/quote]

Than check your code haha, I did my part.

Read full topic

item.title: Smithing.. Please help
item.dc:creator: @KFC KFC
item.description:
@KFC wrote:

[quote=“xxx123xxx, post:4, topic:459799”][code=java]
package server.model.players.packets;

import server.model.players.Client;
import server.model.players.PacketType;
/**

  • Bank X Items
    **/
    public class BankX2 implements PacketType {
    @Override
    public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) {
    int Xamount = c.getInStream().readDWord();
    if (Xamount == 0)
    Xamount = 1;
    switch (c.xInterfaceId) {

                     case 5064:
                 	if(c.inTrade) {
                         	c.sendMessage("You can't store items while trading!");
                         		return;
                 	}
                 	c.getItems().bankItem(c.playerItems[c.xRemoveSlot] , c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
                 break;
                         
                 case 5382:
                 	c.getItems().fromBank(c.bankItems[c.xRemoveSlot] , c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
                 break;

                 case 3322:
                 	if(!c.getItems().playerHasItem(c.xRemoveId, Xamount))
                 		return;
                 	if(c.duelStatus <= 0) {
            			 c.getTradeAndDuel().tradeItem(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
    			 } else {                                
                         	c.getTradeAndDuel().stakeItem(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
                 	 }  
                 break;
                         
                 case 3415: 
                 	if(!c.getItems().playerHasItem(c.xRemoveId, Xamount))
                			return;
                 if(c.duelStatus <= 0) { 
             		c.getTradeAndDuel().fromTrade(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
                 } 
                 break;
                         
                 case 6669:
                 	if(!c.getItems().playerHasItem(c.xRemoveId, Xamount))
                                 return;
                 	c.getTradeAndDuel().fromDuel(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
                 break;                        
         }
         if(c.isSmelting == true)
                 c.getSmithing().startSmelting(c.packetType, Xamount);

    }
    }[/code]
    Yup, you missed a brace at the end.[/quote]
    I get 50 errors with that…

Read full topic

item.title: Smithing.. Please help
item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

[code=java]
package server.model.players.packets;

import server.model.players.Client;
import server.model.players.PacketType;
/**

  • Bank X Items
    **/
    public class BankX2 implements PacketType {
    @Override
    public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) {
    int Xamount = c.getInStream().readDWord();
    if (Xamount == 0)
    Xamount = 1;
    switch (c.xInterfaceId) {

                     case 5064:
                 	if(c.inTrade) {
                         	c.sendMessage("You can't store items while trading!");
                         		return;
                 	}
                 	c.getItems().bankItem(c.playerItems[c.xRemoveSlot] , c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
                 break;
                         
                 case 5382:
                 	c.getItems().fromBank(c.bankItems[c.xRemoveSlot] , c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
                 break;

                 case 3322:
                 	if(!c.getItems().playerHasItem(c.xRemoveId, Xamount))
                 		return;
                 	if(c.duelStatus <= 0) {
            			 c.getTradeAndDuel().tradeItem(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
    			 } else {                                
                         	c.getTradeAndDuel().stakeItem(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
                 	 }  
                 break;
                         
                 case 3415: 
                 	if(!c.getItems().playerHasItem(c.xRemoveId, Xamount))
                			return;
                 if(c.duelStatus <= 0) { 
             		c.getTradeAndDuel().fromTrade(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
                 } 
                 break;
                         
                 case 6669:
                 	if(!c.getItems().playerHasItem(c.xRemoveId, Xamount))
                                 return;
                 	c.getTradeAndDuel().fromDuel(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
                 break;                        
         }
         if(c.isSmelting == true)
                 c.getSmithing().startSmelting(c.packetType, Xamount);

    }
    }[/code]
    Yup, you missed a brace at the end.

Read full topic

item.title: Smithing.. Please help
item.dc:creator: @KFC KFC
item.description:
@KFC wrote:

[code]package server.model.players.packets;

import server.model.players.Client;
import server.model.players.PacketType;
/**

  • Bank X Items
    **/
    public class BankX2 implements PacketType {
    @Override
    public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) {
    int Xamount = c.getInStream().readDWord();
    if (Xamount == 0)
    Xamount = 1;
    switch (c.xInterfaceId) {
    case 5064:
    if(c.inTrade) {
    c.sendMessage(“You can’t store items while trading!”);
    return;
    }
    c.getItems().bankItem(c.playerItems[c.xRemoveSlot] , c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
    break;

     	case 5382:
 	c.getItems().fromBank(c.bankItems[c.xRemoveSlot] , c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
 	break;

 	case 3322:
 	if(!c.getItems().playerHasItem(c.xRemoveId, Xamount))
 	return;
 	if(c.duelStatus <= 0) {
     	c.getTradeAndDuel().tradeItem(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
     } else {				
 		c.getTradeAndDuel().stakeItem(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
 	}  
 	break;
 		
 	case 3415: 
 	if(!c.getItems().playerHasItem(c.xRemoveId, Xamount))
 	return;
 	if(c.duelStatus <= 0) { 
     	c.getTradeAndDuel().fromTrade(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
 	} 
 	break;
 		
 	case 6669:
 	if(!c.getItems().playerHasItem(c.xRemoveId, Xamount))
 			return;
 	c.getTradeAndDuel().fromDuel(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
 	break;			
 }
 if(c.isSmelting == true)
 	c.getSmithing().startSmelting(c.packetType, Xamount);

}[/code]

Read full topic
